channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. investors liked the Stargate AI news. Asian investors loved it.
Adidas has ‘brand heat,’ analysts say. It’s a hot stock, too.
Netflix is raising prices. Here’s how much more your plan will cost.
Mark Zuckerberg is reportedly blaming former Meta exec Sheryl Sandberg for a company inclusivity initiative
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg is overhauling Meta's DEI initiatives — and reportedly blaming his former COO, Sheryl Sandberg, for an old policy.

item.title: J&J’s stock surrenders early gains as weak sales guidance offsets earnings beat
Oracle, Nvidia, other Big Tech stocks jump as Trump unveils Stargate AI project
Overdone price hikes, the demise of ‘quiet luxury,’ and sluggish European tourism—here’s what Bank of America expects will shape luxury in 2025
item.description: “We think that like the game of snakes and ladders, 2025 will see many ups and downs for the luxury sector,” Bank of America analysts said.

item.title: Walgreens replaced its refrigerator doors with digitized ad-laden glass. It might become a $200 million debacle
item.description: In December, Cooler Screens shut down access to hundreds of the digitized fridge doors, which Walgreens claims affected sales.

item.title: Apple’s Tim Cook took home $74.6 million last year. But he started out in the world of work with a humble $1.10-an-hour job
item.description: The Apple CEO got his first job at just 11 and couldn’t afford his MBA without working.

item.title: Stripe mistakenly sent some workers an image of a duck as it announced 300 lay offs
item.description: Stripe is laying off 300 employees, Fortune has learned. The company told staffers it would keep growing headcount despite the cuts.
